name: Outro
_source: speak;Larachel;Please, speak nothing of it.|It is heaven's dictate that I come here to cleanse this charming place of monsters.|What's important is-|Oh my!|I just realized I have not yet had the honor of your name.
speak;Eirika;Oh, you're right.|How strange...|We've met so often now that I had assumed you already...|Please forgive my lack of manners.|My name is Eirika.
speak;Eirika;It's all right, Seth.|She's clearly not our enemy.

speak;Larachel;Eirika...|Aha!|So you must be Princess Eirika of Renais!|It is simply an honor to meet you.|And how strange that we should meet again in this place.|You must be lost as well.|This continent is so confusing.
speak;Eirika;Um, yes.|Actually, we're not lost at all.|You see...
speak;Larachel;Is that so!|Well, clearly, I must be allowed to accompany you.
speak;Eirika;You want to travel with us?|I appreciate your offer, but our journey is far too perilous.|I do not wish to pull you into this madness.
speak;Larachel;No, no, no.|There can be no doubt that we were sent here to aid you.|It is all part of the grand design.|I, L'Arachel, shall play my role and fulfill my divine duties.|This I swear!
speak;Seth;Are you sure this is wise, Princess?
speak;Larachel;...Well, that's that, Dozla.|You and I are now traveling with Eirika and her companions.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|I understand.|For you, Lady L'Arachel, I would do absolutely anything!|I would run to the ends of this world and dive into a sea of evil!
speak;Larachel;How very like you, my dear, dedicated Dozla!|So noble!|Come!|We're off!
speak;Ewan;Teeeaaaacher...|Hellooooooo...|That's strange.|He's not here.|Must be out wandering again.
speak;Eirika;He's out?|That poses a problem.|Do you know when he'll return?
speak;Ewan;Hmmm...|I don't know.|He often goes out and looks for people in need.
speak;Saleh;...I believe I told you it would be best to stay away.
speak;Saleh;I've been charged with a mission and must depart again soon.
speak;Eirika;Y-you...|We've met before, haven't we?|You were looking for someone...
speak;Saleh;...Oh, yes.|And now we meet again.

speak;Ewan;These people say they want to go through Caer Pelyn.|I could guide them myself, but I thought it might be better if you went, too. |That's why I brought them here.|What do you say?|Will you guide them?
speak;Saleh;...Very well.|I'm heading there now.|If you need to go to Caer Pelyn, you're free to follow me.

speak;Saleh;We have little interest in the outside world, but we do not refuse travelers.|I should warn you.|The road is not easy, and you look very weary.|You should rest a night before attempting the mountains.
speak;Innes;We do need rest, it's true.|We are all exhausted from our encounter with those creatures.|We must give our men time to heal, or they'll be useless in an emergency.
speak;Ewan;It's settled then.|I'll go on ahead and let the elder know we're coming.|See?|Even when there's no fighting to be done, I'm still useful!
speak;Eirika;No, wait!|...He's gone.|I wonder if he'll be all right.
speak;Innes;Idiotic boy.|I understand his need to be helpful, but...
speak;Saleh;Ewan knows this land well.|You needn't worry about him.|We'll depart at sunrise.|I suggest you all get some rest.
speak;Eirika;Who?|You...|You're General Glen of Grado.|We met once in the capital, didn't we?|You were very kind to me.|However, if you're here now, I have to assume this means...

speak;Glen;Yes, it does.|I wish our reunion could come under different circumstances.|Eirika, I must tell you, I come here on the direct orders of the emperor.|I'm to bring to justice the rebel army leader who's been terrorizing Carcino.|It's you, Eirika.|They say you've been murdering innocents.

speak;Glen;...If you have something to say, I would hear it.|I know all too well that Grado has robbed you of your homeland, but even so...|I do not believe revenge could drive a woman like you to such depths.|And yet...|here you are in Carcino with a small army under your command.|And the emperor tells us that you massacred everyone in Port Kiris.
speak;Innes;...This is ridiculous.|Believe what you want.|Could one of the legendary Imperial Three honestly be as stupid as this?

speak;Innes;Carcino betrayed Frelia and set a pack of mercenary dogs to kill me.|And you paint Eirika a rebel instigator?|It's an absurd farce.|Your emperor commits horrors, and you believe Eirika is a criminal?
speak;Innes;You truly are blind, aren't you?|You're one of the Imperial Three, and yet you can't see your emperor's plan?

speak;Eirika;That's enough, Innes.|There's no need to provoke him.|General Glen, we've told you what we know to be true, what we've seen firsthand.|We don't want to fight you...|But if you push us, we will drive you back to Grado with your tail between your legs.

speak;Glen;...I see.|You...are more observant than you know.|I am ignorant of the emperor's designs.|General Duessel and I both questioned the wisdom of this war.|And if you really are innocent of the crimes attributed to you...|Why would His Majesty lie to us?|I must know the answer.

speak;Glen;The Princess Eirika I met long ago was kind and merciful in spirit.|You've faced relentless hardship, and yet that selfsame spirit remains true.|...Let's put our fight aside for now.|I will learn the truth.|Then I will once again perform the duties of my office.|If you have lied to me today, I will hound you to the very grave itself.
speak;Valter;Glen.|Where do you think you're going?

speak;Valter;Tsk, tsk.|What am I to make of this?|Those little birds I saw flitting away into the mountains looked vaguely familiar.|What do you suppose would happen if it were known you let Eirika escape?
speak;Glen;Do as you will.|I'm returning to the capital.|I have questions for the emperor.|Clear the path, Valter.
speak;Valter;Hold on now.|No reason to rush off, is there?|After all, this is where you're going to die.|See?
speak;Valter;Heh heh...|We were a grand trio-the Imperial Three.|You, Duessel, and me.|But my place among you was stolen, and I was exiled from Grado.
speak;Glen;You slaughtered people who had no intention of fighting.|The emperor's punishment was just and warranted.

speak;Valter;Heh heh...heh heh heh...|After my fall from glory, only desire kept me alive.|Desire for revenge.|My hatred burned so fierce that I was only barely able to keep my sanity.|That hatred keeps me warm still today.|Oh, how it burns...
speak;Valter;Hear me, Glen, wyvern general of the Imperial Three.|I live for battle.|I crave it.|I have no need for peace.|That is why you must die.
speak;Valter;Heh heh...|This is merely the beginning.|Endless battle, war without end...|Heh heh...|ha hahahahahaha!
